description_txt: stated on June 20, 2010 in an appearance on Newsmakers:
quote_txt: "Deepwater's own testimony . . . is they said they'll create six jobs."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • September 17, 2010

description_txt: stated on September 3, 2010 in a TV ad.:
quote_txt: Ed Schultz said Alan Grayson is "what it's all about."

description_txt: stated on September 12, 2010 in a TV ad.:
quote_txt: "700 jobs (were) lost because Allen Boyd" voted for the health care bill.

description_txt: stated on September 15, 2010 in a statement on campaign web site:
quote_txt: "She created the Waste, Fraud and Mismanagement Hotline.... (that) has saved Wisconsin taxpayers hundreds of thousands of dollars."

description_txt: stated on August 25, 2010 in a posting on Facebook:
quote_txt: Says a "Pro-Stimulus economist admits it is not working … "

description_txt: stated on September 13, 2010 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: Allen West called Social Security a "Ponzi scheme" and said "this country's got to get on sound footing by destroying it."

description_txt: stated on August 22, 2010 in a television campaign ad:
quote_txt: "You can’t raise taxes in Ohio. We are one of the highest taxed states in the country."

description_txt: stated on September 14, 2010 in a campaign commercial:
quote_txt: Taxpayers pay $18,000 a month for House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's district office in downtown San Francisco.

description_txt: stated on August 17, 2010 in a TV commercial:
quote_txt: Roy Barnes is like Barack Obama because they're both doing a lot of apologizing.

description_txt: stated on March 18, 2010 in written testimony to a Wisconsin Senate committee:
quote_txt: "Over 22,000 unique Internet Protocol addresses -- in Wisconsin alone -- have downloaded child pornography."

description_txt: stated on September 6, 2010 in a TV ad.:
quote_txt: Says opponent Bill Flores helped run a company that laid off over 3,000 workers and paid off executives with millions.

description_txt: stated on September 12, 2010 in a roundtable discussion on ABC's "This Week with Christiane Amanpour'':
quote_txt: "Over 10 years, (extending tax cuts for the wealthy) would add less to the deficit than Obama added with the stimulus in one year."

description_txt: stated on September 14, 2010 in a statement to the press:
quote_txt: On whether President Obama's speeches to school children spread "socialist ideology."

description_txt: stated on September 13, 2010 in a campaign website:
quote_txt: "Florida ranks last in the ratio of employees to residents... And Florida is dead last in the nation in state employee payroll expenditures per resident."

description_txt: stated on August 23, 2010 in an election ad:
quote_txt: DeWine "took $1.9 million from big banks," "supported legislation that helped Bernie Madoff make millions" and "protected predatory lenders while families lost their homes."

description_txt: stated on September 8, 2010 in a campaign TV ad:
quote_txt: Russ Feingold "has not worked anywhere outside of politics."

description_txt: stated on September 8, 2010 in an interview:
quote_txt: Says Texas U.S. Rep. Pete Sessions said the GOP's goal is to "go back to the same exact policies that were in place before this president took office... policies that crashed the economy."

description_txt: stated on September 7, 2010 in a presentation:
quote_txt: Clayton County has employed 1,300 people over the past seven months through the Neighborhood Stabilization Program.

description_txt: stated on September 12, 2010 in ABC's "This Week":
quote_txt: John Boehner has called for "repealing the rest of the stimulus, which would raise taxes on 110 million middle class people."

description_txt: stated on September 12, 2010 in an interview on "This Week.":
quote_txt: Extending current tax rates would "average more than $100,000 a year to millionaires and even billionaires."

description_txt: stated on September 12, 2010 in a White House news release:
quote_txt: Says John Boehner changed his position on extending Bush tax cuts.

description_txt: stated on September 10, 2010 in comments at the Republican Party of Florida's annual meeting.:
quote_txt: "We will be the first party to elect a bald guy to governor."

description_txt: stated on September 6, 2010 in a speech on Labor Day:
quote_txt: John Boehner wants to reopen a tax loophole "that actually rewarded corporations for shipping jobs and profits overseas."

description_txt: stated on August 18, 2010 in an interview:
quote_txt: "I don’t understand what Republicans are doing against this. It was their idea. John McCain introduced cap and trade legislation three times."

description_txt: stated on September 10, 2010 in campaign literature distributed by an outside group:
quote_txt: "Senator Jeff Plale saved my job" -- and some 300 others at Bucyrus International.

description_txt: stated on September 10, 2010 in campaign literature distributed by an outside group:
quote_txt: "While many of his colleagues turned down a $2,500 pay raise ... (Jeff) Plale pocketed the extra money."

description_txt: stated on August 3, 2010 in a report:
quote_txt: Federal stimulus money went to a Georgia Tech project that will "apparently involve the professor jamming with 'world-renowned musicians' to 'hopefully also create satisfying works of art.'"

description_txt: stated on August 6, 2010 in a campaign TV ad:
quote_txt: "Walker says he’s for lower taxes. But Milwaukee County spending has gone up by $349 million."

description_txt: stated on July 28, 2010 in a press release.:
quote_txt: Jeff Weems' "legal record is one of defending BP, Enron and just about every big oil company against the working man."

description_txt: stated on September 9, 2010 in a campaign TV ad:
quote_txt: Scott Walker supported the same transportation bill he’s attacking me for. He said at the time it would save the taxpayers money.
